intro: Androstachys johnsonii, commonly known as Johnson's androstachys, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments and has lance-shaped leaves with a smooth texture. Its blooming period occurs during the spring and early summer, producing fragrant white to pale yellow flowers. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
